headline.main: TRADERS ATTACK LEASE-LEND GAIN; Regular Exporters Frozen Out by Direct Deals With Foreign States, They Charge

lead_paragraph: Resentment over the prevailing policy under the Lease-Lend Act, by which purchases are made and forwarded directly by foreign government agencies instead of through American foreign traders, was brought into the open yesterday when John A. Zellers, chairman of the international trade committee of the Advertising Club of New York, announced that the committee had unanimously passed and sent a resolution of protest to Edward R. Stettinius Jr., Lease-Lend Administrator.
abstract: Protests regular trade channel curbs by foreign govt purchasing burs

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: FREIGHT FORWARDERS AND BROKERS ASSN, FOREIGN
